intro: Paracaryum microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited paracaryum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, capsule-like fruits and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
